m_szDocTitle: Transport and the Hydrogen Economy - World Nuclear Association
m_szDocSumamry: Transport and the Hydrogen Economy (Updated October 2015) Hydrogen is widely seen as a future transport fuel, but that future is probably further off than popularly perceived. In the short term, hybrid and full electric vehicles will substantially increase the demand for base-load power from grid systems. The use of hydrogen in the production of transport fuels from crude oil is increasing rapidly, and is vital where tar sands are the oil source. Nuclear energy can be used to make hydrogen electrolytically, and in the future high-temperature reactors are likely to be used to make it thermochem
